title: Kristen Welker
text:
Kristen Welker (born July 1, 1976) is an American television <a href="journalist">journalist</a> working for <a href="NBC%20News">NBC News</a>. Based in <a href="Washington%2C%20D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a>, Welker shares duties alongside <a href="Peter%20Alexander%20%28journalist%29">Peter Alexander</a> both as the network's co-chief <a href="White%20House%20press%20corps">White House correspondent</a> and as co-anchor of "<a href="Weekend%20Today">Weekend Today</a>", the Saturday edition of "<a href="Today%20%28American%20TV%20program%29">Today</a>". She also was a moderator in the second presidential debate with <a href="Donald%20Trump">Donald Trump</a> and <a href="Joe%20Biden">Joe Biden</a> on October 22, 2020.
Early life and education.
Welker is the daughter of Harvey and Julie Welker. Her father is an engineer, her mother a real estate agent. Welker's father is <a href="White%20Americans">white</a> and her mother is <a href="African%20Americans">African-American</a>. She graduated from <a href="Germantown%20Friends%20School">Germantown Friends School</a> in <a href="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a> in 1994 and <a href="Harvard%20College">Harvard College</a> with a <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts">Bachelor of Arts</a> in 1998. At Harvard, she majored in history and graduated with honors. Welker also interned for "<a href="Today%20%28American%20TV%20program%29">Today</a>" in 1997.
Career.
Welker has worked at <a href="American%20Broadcasting%20Company">ABC</a> affiliates <a href="WLNE-TV">WLNE-TV</a> (2003–2005) in <a href="Providence%2C%20Rhode%20Island">Providence, Rhode Island</a>, and <a href="KRCR-TV">KRCR-TV</a> in <a href="Redding%2C%20California">Redding, California</a>. She joined <a href="NBC">NBC</a> in 2005 at their Philadelphia <a href="owned-and-operated%20station">owned-and-operated station</a>, <a href="WCAU">WCAU</a>, where she was a reporter and weekend anchor. She then joined <a href="NBC%20News">NBC News</a> in 2010 as a correspondent based at the <a href="NBC%20Studios%20%28Burbank%29">NBC News West Coast Headquarters</a> in <a href="Burbank%2C%20California">Burbank, California</a>. She became an NBC White House correspondent in December 2011.
Welker regularly represents <a href="MSNBC">MSNBC</a> at daily White House press briefings and reports live for various programs on the network. She occasionally fills in on "<a href="NBC%20Nightly%20News">NBC Nightly News</a>" and "<a href="Today%20%28American%20TV%20program%29">Today</a>". On January 10, 2020, NBC announced that Welker would become the regular co-anchor of "<a href="Weekend%20Today">Weekend Today</a>" alongside <a href="Peter%20Alexander%20%28journalist%29">Peter Alexander</a>. She debuted as co-anchor on "Weekend Today" on January 11, 2020. In September 2020, she was honored with the award for Outstanding Journalist in Broadcast Television at the Washington Women in Journalism Awards.
Personal life.
Welker married John Hughes, a marketing executive with <a href="Merck%20%26amp%3B%20Co.">Merck</a>, on March 4, 2017 in <a href="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a>. Welker is not registered with any political party. Welker and husband John Hughes became the parents of a baby girl, born via a surrogate, in June 2021.
